metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9951 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in Safari 14.0. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.30.1-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.30.1-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.30.1-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.30.1-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.30.1-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.30.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.30.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.30.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.30.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.30.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.30.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.30.1-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.30.1-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.30.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.30.1-1').
